revised_title: Effects of Cold Environment on Body Composition and Organ Weights in Mice
tldr: The study examines the effects of a cold environment on body composition and organ weights in inbred mice. Mice bred for multiple generations in a cold environment showed improved fitness in the cold, with differences in body weight, organ weights, and body composition compared to mice kept at a warmer temperature. The results suggest that cold adaptation may be due to intracellular changes making individual tissues more efficient.
